intro: Randia tetramera, commonly known as the four-rayed randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Randia tetramera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
